name: Loktak Lake
shortDescription: The world's only floating lake, home to the dancing deer.

story.overview: Loktak Lake is the largest freshwater lake in Northeast India and is famous for its phumdis (heterogeneous mass of vegetation, soil and organic matter at various stages of decomposition) floating over it.
story.culturalSignificance: It serves as a lifeline for the people of Manipur, providing water for hydropower generation, irrigation, and drinking supply.
story.localBelief: The lake is considered the mother source of life in Moirang folklore.

name: Nohkalikai Falls
shortDescription: One of India's tallest waterfalls, plunging 340 meters.

story.overview: Nohkalikai Falls is one of India's tallest plunge and most breathtaking waterfalls, plunging 340 meters into a deep, emerald-green pool.
story.culturalSignificance: Carries a tragic legend of a woman named Likai.
story.localBelief: Locals respect the pool as a site of grief and beauty.

name: Kangla Fort
shortDescription: The ancient seat of Meitei kings, now a national monument.

story.overview: Kangla Fort is an ancient capital where the Meitei kings ruled for centuries. The sacred complex houses temples, shrines, and the iconic Kangla Sha dragons.
story.culturalSignificance: The spiritual and political heart of Manipur's identity.
story.localBelief: The Kangla Sha (dragon) guards the land of the Meiteis.

name: Dzukou Valley
shortDescription: A stunning valley of flowers on the Nagaland-Manipur border.

story.overview: Dzukou Valley is known for its scenic beauty and biodiversity, especially the Dzukou Lily found nowhere else in the world.
story.culturalSignificance: Considered sacred by the local Angami and Mao tribes.
story.localBelief: The valley is believed to be the abode of spirits.

name: Tawang Monastery
shortDescription: India's largest Buddhist monastery, 400 years old.

story.overview: Founded in 1680-81, Tawang Monastery (Galden Namgey Lhatse) is the largest monastery in India and the second largest in the world after Potala Palace.
story.culturalSignificance: The birthplace of the 6th Dalai Lama and a center of Mahayana Buddhist learning.
story.localBelief: The monastery's library holds sacred manuscripts that carry the wisdom of ages.
